text:
It wout be convenient to have two predefined tasks, which users could
"overwrite", and which is only called once.

The task called __INIT should be called (if defined by the user) before any
other task.

The task called __FINAL should be called (if defined by the user) as the last task
creator: js@nw3.dk
stevel@apache.org
text:
I dont think we should do this. 

there is an implicit init -everything outside any target

As for __FINAL, it depends on how you fail. what if something goes wrong during
cleanup. will people want fault information, etc, etc. It gets complex, fast.
